main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were reported by U.S. Air Force personnel and Spanish military authorities over Madrid, Spain, on February 6, 1964.
interesting points: The objects were described as round, silver-metallic discs pulsating intermittently and moving at extremely high speeds., The sightings coincided with reports from both military and civilian observers., There was significant press and TV coverage following the event., Observations indicated high-speed horizontal, ascending, and descending movements that were not characteristic of conventional aircraft., No evidence of jet or rocket propulsion was found, adding to the mystery of the sighting.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects, described as round silver-metallic discs
witness description: U.S. Air Force personnel and Spanish military authorities
